title: After so many hints, Warwick rework finally confirmed by FeralPony?
body:
We all know that a Warwick rework has been hinted so many times lately. But it seems this is actually a confirmation.

By FeralPony ask.fm:

Question: is Malphite considered for a full VGU? I think he's a boring champion, but sometimes that ult is satisfying, heh.

Answer: Due to the sheer volume of work required for a VGU they're currently prioritizing champions that need a substantial kit update as well as a visual one. It's much better to pair to gameplay and visual updates together when possible so we don't redo a champions visuals and then redo their gameplay which makes us need to redo their visuals and spell effects again, **that's why they're focusing on Yorick and Warwick first**. I'm unsure who they'll be choosing after those guys, I'd assume it's pretty up in the air atm.

I agree.  I like to max blood hunting.  None of this juke into the bush crap.  Q can go, it was never a priority for me.  If he still only scales with attack speed he needs something that amps his attack speed.  I favor a modified blood hunt - keep the increased movement and then the closer he gets to an enemy (large monster or enemy player) low on health the faster his attacks are.  This has the added benefit of limiting using it just to take towers, which didn't fit thematically with his old W.

So keep his ult, it is iconic.  Let him have something that smells out low health enemies, and something that sends him into a frenzy.

Honeslty what I like about him at this point is none of the "third autoattack steals 300% max hp damage and slows the target for 3 seconds decaying" bullshit. That effect is on his Q, where you can decide when to use it, like an impactful part of a kit should be. Don't put WW's old kit onto his passive and then build him three more new abilities.

My favorite part about Warwick is honestly his simplicity.  

I am a player who loves to focus on objective control and "macro" (as opposed to dueling/outplays and "micro").  I love that his kit doesn't require much action. He's one of the only champions left that I can play and still type "care, lb coming from top" DURING a teamfight.  

Yes, people say he's boring as a champ. But that's because they're just not playing him optimally. It's maybe not such a massive deal in higher elos, but in lower elo, players are incredibly unorganized. I like being the organizer (a.k.a. ~~shotcaller~~ shotsuggester) of the team. It really helps to make sure that everyone is being productive and that things don't slip through our fingers.  

{{champion:19}} : Peel for adc  
{{champion:19}} : MAOKAI TOP GO HAM  
{{champion:19}} : good work team what's our next objective?
*team pings various objectives and agrees to take mid tower and inhib as the teamfight comes to an end*

Imagine if a different champion tried to type all that in the middle of heated battle. That's just not happening without taking a huge hit to your DPS.
Not all champions need to have engaging kits to be fun. That's just my two cents.
I'm not a serious Warwick player, but his synergy with On-hit effects, especially with his ultimate, should stay.

1) It has a lot of emphasis on **objective taking**. I am a bronze sloth in matter of mechanics so my best is when i start planning around the map, denying camps and keeping myself healthy and steady for a gank.

2) I like his E, for how much passive and uninteractive it is, and i love the feeling when i pull off a good gank thank to it ( mostly pre-6. yes, pre-6 ganks with ww are a thing). **Making it more interactive however**, maybe increasing his team-vision utility might be intresting both because you have much more levers to put hands, because it has the potential to become really something.

I am not sure if he was more amazed or worried :D But something on the lines of that would be intresting, so he has a fallback team utility pattern unique ( sorta) to him.

4) **I just don' t like his W**. Like, i press it once in a while in fight and i just hope to get it right. probably there are better times to use it, but once i notice i have the carry nearby and ready to fight i don' t care much more.

5) I like his Q. it' s simple, but effective. It' s both an utility that allows WW to heal back once he reached the front to start draining with emphasis on target selection ( i target the squishy, which is far but so i wrekt it, or i go to the more approchable tank that might also heal me better?) and a **call to action** so he is not immediately pushed back without hope to do anything meaningful, always lured back to the frontline. It can get a lot better thought

6) I am the only one who does not like much his passive? I don' t loathe it but it overall means that WW has to build Wit' s End or similiar attack speed items. Which might be cool aniway, but probably can be done better and with **less item bond**?

7) I find his ultimate **unremarkable**, I like it only because it gets along with my bronze mechanics ( and sometimes i feel offended when i think about it ) and i would like to have a tad more impact over it, maybe not necessarily with a different targeting paradigm but with more decision making; for example making the enemy soppressed longer the more i have attacked it already? makes you decide between instant suppression or delayed but more powerful one to allow your team to catch up. just to give you the idea of what i mean.

Gotta be honest and say that I'm not really a big fan of Warwick's current kit at all.

Not because it is simplistic, or because of how dated it is compared to the kits of new champs today, but because I just don't think it meshes well with his fantasy and thematic. I mean, when I think of the core concepts of a werewolf, I picture a furious killing machine filled with rage, ripping things apart. If not for his current kit, drain tank would not enter my mind at all.

I once did sit down to try and design a kit for him myself. I still wanted to keep him mainly a jungler, but rather than a tank I wanted him to be more of a fighter/diver.

I wanted to keep some of his old aspects, like howling to hunt and being good at chasing down prey, but I also wanted to give him more moves to use in combat. I also really wanted to have him running on all fours during the chase... So the first thing I did was make his W swap between two and four legs, with different abilities on Q and E depending on the stance. Standing upright would be for combat, and down on all fours would be for tracking and chasing.

I figured he'd need to be able to pounce while chasing, so I put that on his Q, and for tracking I put his howl as an active ability on E. Then I stepped back to look at how my attempt at a kit was progressing, realized I had pretty much just unintentionally copied Rek'Sai, and lost all motivation to continue.

I really do hope he gets to run on all fours somehow in the new rework though, as I think it would look absolutely awesome! And I think Warwick is a great candidate for a stance swapping kit.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qoV7EO9N,comment-id=000600010000,timestamp=2016-05-03T20:14:51.364+0000)

As a fellow Warwick main, I think Warwick is a great champ even as is, however there are a few things that I would like changed.

I would like to see Warwick's Q deal AD, AP just feels wrong for him. Also knocks enemies back.(Gives him something to aid in pre 6 ganks).

Warwick's W is great for getting assists and taking objectives but it really just feels out of place. The way I see it, Warwick is all about chasing low opponents down and finishing them off.

A great way to aid in his mobility would be to give him a Dash type ability that, when activated, gives Warwick(just Warwick) additional attack speed just like his current W. The Dash can be used to get over obstacles like Ekko's also should deal AD when used on enemy champ.

Warwick's E feels tacked on and while the passive is essential to keeping the spirit of Warwick that doesn't mean it couldn't be altered a bit for the better. I'm thinking Warwick's E should be just about the same as it does now except instead of just giving Warwick movement speed when an enemy champ is low, how about vamping movement speed from low enemy champs, much like Chilling Smite works now. (Only activates on nearest low champ.)

And now we come to Warwick's R, something just feels wrong about Warwick's R being so easy to perform. The payoff is too high to just be a point and click ability. I don't want to alienate current Warwick players but I think replacing the blink type R Warwick currently has, with a skill shot lunge will really make Warwick much more satisfying to play. Also instead of dealing AP, Deal AD.

This also gives Riot a chance to make the R animation look better, instead of Warwick just magically appearing on an enemy champ he would now lunge towards them and have a tackle like animation. The Suppress has to stay of course but as balance to his added mobility maybe have the suppress end even sooner.

With these additions to his kit there will undoubtedly need to be some adjustments but I think in the long run it will be worth it and Warwick will become a much more satisfying champ to play. 

Summary:
Q: Deals AD instead of AP. Knocks enemies back.
W: Dash, when activated gives Warwick additional attack speed (No longer gives nearby friendly champs attack speed). Also deals AD when it hits champion.
E: Passive: Vamps movement speed from low champs instead of just giving Warwick movement speed. (Only activates on nearest low champ.)
R: Skill shot lunge that deals AD and suppresses(shorter duration).
